desc: List all files in the current directory in long format
explanation: Lists files in the current directory with details such as permissions, owner, size, and modification time.

desc: Change the current working directory to '/etc'
explanation: Changes the current working directory to /etc.

desc: Show the absolute path of the current working directory
explanation: Prints the full path of the current directory.

desc: Create an empty file named 'notes.txt'
explanation: Creates a new empty file or updates its timestamp if it already exists.

desc: Show the first 5 lines of the file 'notes.txt'
explanation: Displays only the first 5 lines of the file.

desc: Show the last 10 lines of the file 'notes.txt'
explanation: Prints the last 10 lines of the file.

desc: Count the number of lines in 'notes.txt'
explanation: Counts and prints the number of lines in the file.

desc: Search for the word 'error' in the file 'app.log'
explanation: Searches for lines containing 'error' in the file app.log.

desc: View the contents of 'config.conf' page by page
explanation: Opens the file in a pager, allowing scrolling and searching.

desc: Show the file type of 'image.png'
explanation: Examines the file and prints its type (e.g., PNG image).

desc: Create a new directory named 'projects'
explanation: Creates a directory called projects in the current working directory.

desc: Remove an empty directory named 'old'
explanation: Removes the directory 'old' if it is empty.

desc: Show file system disk space usage in human-readable form
explanation: Displays available and used disk space for mounted file systems in human-readable units.

desc: Show disk usage summary of the current directory
explanation: Summarizes the total disk usage of the current directory in human-readable format.

desc: Print the basename of the path '/usr/local/bin/python3'
explanation: Extracts the final component of a pathname (here: 'python3').

desc: Print the directory name of the path '/usr/local/bin/python3'
explanation: Strips the last component and prints only the directory path (here: '/usr/local/bin').

desc: Show detailed information about the file 'notes.txt'
explanation: Displays size, blocks, permissions, timestamps, and inode of the file.

desc: Show hidden files in the current directory
explanation: Lists all files including hidden ones that begin with a dot.

desc: List directory contents recursively starting from the current directory
explanation: Recursively lists all subdirectories and their contents.

desc: Display a tree-like view of the current directory
explanation: Shows the directory structure as a tree (requires 'tree' package installed).

desc: Copy the file 'notes.txt' to a new file named 'backup.txt'
explanation: Copies the file notes.txt to a new file called backup.txt.

desc: Move the file 'report.pdf' into the directory 'archive/'
explanation: Moves the file report.pdf into the archive directory.

desc: Rename the file 'oldname.txt' to 'newname.txt'
explanation: Uses mv to rename a file by moving it to a new name.

desc: Copy the directory 'project' to 'project_backup' including all contents
explanation: Copies a directory recursively with all its files and subdirectories.

desc: Remove the file 'old.log'
explanation: Deletes the file old.log from the filesystem.

desc: Remove the directory 'tempdir' and all its contents recursively
explanation: Recursively deletes a directory and everything inside it. Use with caution!

desc: Create a symbolic link named 'latest.log' pointing to 'app.log'
explanation: Creates a symbolic link named latest.log that points to app.log.

desc: Copy 'script.sh' to 'script.sh.bak' and preserve permissions and timestamps
explanation: The -p option preserves mode, ownership, and timestamps when copying.

desc: Copy multiple files 'a.txt' and 'b.txt' into the directory 'backup/'
explanation: Copies both a.txt and b.txt into the backup directory.

desc: Create parent directories 'data/2025/reports' in one command
explanation: The -p option creates parent directories as needed without errors.

desc: Display the contents of 'notes.txt' to the terminal
explanation: Prints the entire file contents to standard output.

desc: Concatenate and number all lines in 'notes.txt'
explanation: Displays the contents of notes.txt with line numbers.

desc: View 'notes.txt' one screen at a time using 'more'
explanation: Opens the file with the more pager to navigate page by page.

desc: Follow new lines being added to 'app.log' in real time
explanation: Continuously displays new lines appended to the file.

desc: Show line numbers while viewing 'config.conf' with less
explanation: Opens config.conf in less with line numbers displayed.

desc: Display non-printing characters in 'notes.txt'
explanation: cat -v makes non-printable characters visible in the output.

desc: Show the first 20 lines of 'report.txt'
explanation: Displays the first 20 lines of report.txt.

desc: Show the last 50 lines of 'system.log'
explanation: Displays the last 50 lines of system.log.

desc: Display line, word, and character counts for 'essay.txt'
explanation: Shows counts for lines, words, and characters in the file.

desc: Number non-empty output lines of 'notes.txt'
explanation: The nl command numbers only non-blank lines in the output.

desc: Sort the lines in 'names.txt' alphabetically
explanation: Sorts the lines of names.txt in ascending alphabetical order.

desc: Remove duplicate lines from 'emails.txt'
explanation: Filters out adjacent duplicate lines in emails.txt.

desc: Sort 'emails.txt' and remove duplicates
explanation: Sorting first ensures all duplicates are adjacent, then uniq removes them.

desc: Count how many times 'warning' appears in 'system.log'
explanation: The -c option makes grep count matches instead of printing them.

desc: Show only the second column from 'data.csv' (comma-separated)
explanation: Uses cut with delimiter ',' to extract the second field from each line.

desc: Replace all occurrences of 'foo' with 'bar' in 'notes.txt' and show the result
explanation: sed substitutes all instances of 'foo' with 'bar' in each line and prints the result to stdout.

desc: Print only the first 10 characters of each line in 'notes.txt'
explanation: The -c option selects character positions; here, the first 10 characters.

desc: Translate all lowercase letters to uppercase in 'notes.txt'
explanation: The tr command maps lowercase letters to uppercase while reading from stdin.

desc: Compare the files 'old.conf' and 'new.conf' line by line
explanation: diff shows the differences between two files line by line.

desc: Print all lines from 'data.txt' that do NOT contain 'success'
explanation: The -v option inverts the match, showing only lines without the pattern.

desc: Show system and kernel information
explanation: Prints all available system information including kernel name, version, and architecture.

desc: Display your current username
explanation: Prints the effective username of the current user.

desc: Show your user ID and group IDs
explanation: Displays user ID (uid), group ID (gid), and groups the user belongs to.

desc: Show how long the system has been running
explanation: Displays the current time, system uptime, number of users, and load averages.

desc: Show memory usage in human-readable format
explanation: Shows the total, used, and free memory in human-readable units.

desc: Display disk usage of all mounted file systems in human-readable format
explanation: Shows disk space usage for all mounted filesystems with human-friendly sizes.

desc: Display currently running processes in real time
explanation: Opens an interactive view of processes, CPU, and memory usage.

desc: Show all running processes
explanation: Lists all running processes with detailed information.

desc: Print all environment variables
explanation: Displays the environment variables available in the current shell.

desc: Show the last 20 commands from your shell history
explanation: Displays the 20 most recent commands executed in the shell.

desc: Show your current IP addresses
explanation: Displays network interfaces and their assigned IP addresses.

desc: Show the routing table
explanation: Lists the system's IP routing table.

desc: Test connectivity to 'example.com' with 4 ICMP packets
explanation: Sends 4 ping requests to example.com to test network connectivity.

desc: Display active network connections and listening ports
explanation: Shows all TCP/UDP sockets that are listening or established (net-tools required).

desc: Show DNS records for 'example.com'
explanation: Queries DNS servers for information about example.com (requires dnsutils).

desc: Display only IPv4 addresses for 'example.com'
explanation: Shows only the A records (IPv4 addresses) of example.com.

desc: Download a file from 'http://example.com/file.txt'
explanation: Fetches a file from the web using wget (requires wget).

desc: Fetch the headers of 'https://example.com' with curl
explanation: Uses curl to send a HEAD request and display HTTP headers.

desc: Show the system's hostname
explanation: Prints the system's hostname.

desc: Show open ports with process IDs
explanation: Lists TCP/UDP sockets along with the processes using them.

desc: Create a gzip-compressed tar archive of the current directory named 'project.tar.gz'
explanation: Creates a tarball of the current directory and compresses it with gzip.

desc: List the contents of the gzip tarball 'project.tar.gz' without extracting
explanation: Shows files inside a gzip-compressed tar archive.

desc: Extract the gzip tarball 'project.tar.gz' into the current directory
explanation: Extracts all files from the archive into the working directory.

desc: Extract 'project.tar.gz' into an existing directory 'extract_here/'
explanation: Uses -C to change to the target directory before extracting.

desc: Create a bzip2-compressed tar archive of the directory 'logs/' named 'logs.tar.bz2'
explanation: Creates a tarball and compresses it with bzip2 using -j.

desc: Create an xz-compressed tar archive of the directory 'src/' named 'src.tar.xz'
explanation: Creates a tarball and compresses it with xz using -J.

desc: Create a ZIP archive 'site.zip' from the directory 'public/'
explanation: Recursively adds files from public/ into a ZIP archive (requires 'zip').

desc: Extract the ZIP archive 'site.zip' into the directory 'extracted/'
explanation: Unpacks a ZIP file to the specified destination directory (requires 'unzip').

desc: Compress the file 'report.txt' with gzip while keeping the original file
explanation: Compresses report.txt to report.txt.gz and keeps the original with -k (keep).

desc: Show the first 20 lines of the compressed file 'report.txt.gz' without fully extracting
explanation: zcat decompresses to stdout; piping to head previews the beginning of the file.

desc: Show the history of previously executed commands
explanation: Lists all commands you have run in the current shell session (or from history file).

desc: Run the last command again
explanation: Repeats the most recently executed command in the shell.

desc: Run the last command starting with 'ls'
explanation: Re-executes the most recent command that began with 'ls'.

desc: Run a command 'sleep 5' in the background
explanation: Adding '&' at the end of a command runs it in the background.

desc: Show all background jobs
explanation: Lists all current jobs running in the background of the shell.

desc: Bring job number 1 back to the foreground
explanation: Brings the background job with ID 1 into the foreground.

desc: Suspend the running process with Ctrl+Z and then resume it in the background
explanation: Ctrl+Z suspends a process; 'bg' resumes it in the background.

desc: Create an alias 'll' for 'ls -l'
explanation: Defines a shell alias 'll' that expands to 'ls -l'.

desc: Display the last exit status of a command
explanation: Prints the exit status of the most recently executed command. 0 means success.

desc: Make the file 'script.sh' executable by the owner
explanation: Adds execute permission for the file owner.

desc: Recursively set read and write permissions for owner and group on 'project/'
explanation: Applies permissions recursively: owner and group can read/write, others no access.

desc: Find all files larger than 10 MB in the current directory tree
explanation: Searches for regular files bigger than 10 megabytes.

desc: Find files modified within the last 24 hours
explanation: Searches for files modified less than 1 day ago.

desc: Search recursively for 'TODO' in source code files
explanation: Recursively searches for 'TODO' with case-insensitive matching and line numbers.

desc: Find all '.txt' files and search for 'ERROR' inside them
explanation: Uses find with -print0 and xargs -0 to safely pass filenames to grep.

desc: Redirect the output of 'ls' into a file 'files.txt'
explanation: Overwrites files.txt with the output of ls.

desc: Append the text 'hello' to 'notes.txt'
explanation: Appends the string 'hello' to notes.txt.

desc: Redirect errors from 'grep' into 'errors.txt'
explanation: Redirects standard error to errors.txt.

desc: Count running processes sorted by memory usage
explanation: Pipes ps output to sort by memory column, then shows top results.

desc: List files and save output to both terminal and 'out.txt'
explanation: tee writes output to a file and also passes it through to stdout.

desc: Print the current date inside a string
explanation: Uses command substitution to embed command output inside another command.

desc: Show the full path of the 'bash' binary
explanation: Prints the location of the binary that would be executed for 'bash'.

desc: Open the manual page for the 'ls' command
explanation: Displays the manual for ls with description and options.

desc: Merge 'a.txt' and 'b.txt' line by line into one output
explanation: Combines lines from multiple files side by side.

desc: Show common lines between two sorted files 'a.txt' and 'b.txt'
explanation: Prints the lines that appear in both sorted files.

desc: Generate SHA256 checksum of 'image.iso'
explanation: Computes the SHA256 digest of a file to verify integrity.

desc: Show the first 100 bytes of 'data.bin'
explanation: Displays the first 100 bytes of the file without decoding.

desc: Sort numbers in 'numbers.txt' in reverse numeric order
explanation: Sorts lines as numbers in descending order.

desc: Sort human-readable sizes in 'sizes.txt' correctly
explanation: Sorts values with units (K, M, G) correctly using -h.

desc: Show kernel messages in human-readable form, one screen at a time
explanation: Displays the kernel ring buffer with timestamps, piped into less for easy navigation.

desc: Give the file 'script.sh' read, write, and execute permissions for the owner, and read/execute for others
explanation: Sets permissions so the owner can read/write/execute, while group and others can read/execute.

desc: Set permissions of 'file.txt' so the owner can read/write and others can only read
explanation: Sets read/write for owner, read-only for group and others.

desc: Show the current default file creation mask
explanation: Displays the current umask value, which determines default file permissions.

desc: Change the owner of 'notes.txt' to user 'alice'
explanation: Changes the file owner to alice while keeping the current group unchanged.

desc: List files in long format with human-readable sizes
explanation: The -l option shows detailed listing and -h prints file sizes in human-readable units.

desc: Find the file named 'hosts' anywhere on the system
explanation: Searches a prebuilt database of files for entries matching 'hosts'. Requires 'mlocate' or 'plocate'.

desc: Find the location of the 'ls' binary
explanation: Shows the locations of the binary, source, and man page files for ls.

desc: Kill a process with PID 1234
explanation: Sends the default TERM signal to the process with PID 1234.

desc: Kill all processes named 'firefox'
explanation: Terminates all processes matching the name 'firefox' (requires psmisc).

desc: Shut down the system immediately
explanation: Halts and powers off the system immediately.

desc: Reboot the system immediately
explanation: Restarts the machine immediately.

desc: Open the text file 'notes.txt' in the nano editor
explanation: Opens the file notes.txt in the nano text editor.

desc: Open the text file 'notes.txt' in the vi editor
explanation: Opens the file notes.txt in the vi editor.

desc: Print the current date and time
explanation: Shows the current system date and time.

desc: Display a calendar for the current month
explanation: Shows a simple calendar of the current month.

desc: Switch back to the previous directory
explanation: Changes to the last visited directory.

desc: List files sorted by modification time (newest first)
explanation: Shows files in long format, sorted by modification time descending.

desc: Search for processes containing the word 'python'
explanation: Lists all processes and filters only those with 'python' in their command line.

desc: Kill all processes by name 'vim'
explanation: Sends a termination signal to all processes named vim.

desc: Exit the current shell session
explanation: Closes the current shell session.

desc: Print the current working directory stored in the HOME environment variable
explanation: Displays the path to the current user's home directory from the environment variable.

desc: Set an environment variable named 'EDITOR' to 'nano'
explanation: Defines an environment variable EDITOR with the value nano in the current session.

desc: Show only the first 5 lines of 'data.txt' except the last 5 lines
explanation: Outputs all but the last 5 lines of the file.

desc: Open the manual page for the 'tar' command
explanation: Displays the manual for the tar command with usage and options.

desc: Print the current user's home directory using the environment variable
explanation: Prints the value of the HOME environment variable.

desc: Print the text 'Hello World' to the terminal
explanation: Displays the given text in the terminal.

desc: Clear the terminal screen
explanation: Clears all previous output from the terminal display.

desc: Reset the terminal if it becomes unusable
explanation: Resets the terminal display and restores it to a normal state.

desc: Show how the command 'ls' would be interpreted by the shell
explanation: Displays whether 'ls' is a built-in, an alias, or an external command.

desc: Find the path to the 'python3' executable
explanation: Shows the location of the python3 command in your PATH.

desc: Run a command that always succeeds
explanation: The 'true' command does nothing and exits with status 0.

desc: Run a command that always fails
explanation: The 'false' command does nothing and exits with status 1.

desc: Show which shell you are currently using
explanation: Prints the path to the current shell program.

desc: Show all logged-in users
explanation: Lists all users currently logged into the system.

desc: Show who is logged in and what they are doing
explanation: Displays logged-in users and their current processes and load averages.

desc: Show the groups of the current user
explanation: Lists all groups the current user belongs to.

desc: Display system uptime in a friendly format
explanation: Shows how long the system has been running in a human-friendly format.

desc: Display all printable text strings from the binary file 'program.bin'
explanation: Extracts and prints readable text from a binary file.

desc: Search for 'usb' messages in the kernel log
explanation: Filters kernel ring buffer output for lines containing 'usb'.

desc: Show the first 10 commands from your shell history
explanation: Displays the first 10 entries from your command history using a pipe to head.
